intro: Aphanopleura trachycarpa, commonly known as the rough-fruited aphanopleura, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aphanopleuraceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its rough, textured fruit is a distinguishing feature, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
